index.paragraph1: The digitalisation of society and media systems has had a major impact on (political) discourses and the formation of public opinion. The purpose of this project is to investigate the transnational algorithmic public sphere, a complex phenomenon that has arisen in an era of globalised mass media and social media connectivity across national borders. An interdisciplinary combination of computational linguistics, network visualisation, intercultural hermeneutics and communication science enables us to analyse and map the processes underlying this phenomenon. The project addresses the current political discussion on nuclear power and renewable energy in Germany and Japan following the Fukushima accident.
index.paragraph2: The project aims to make the analysis faster and more fine-grained by introducing a dynamic and interactive computer-assisted software platform. With the key features being: 1) dynamic visualization based on semantic similarities, enabling a faster identificationof discourses. 2) interactive grouping procedure, in which analyst forms discourses by drag & drop. 3) concordance lines are always in view.
index.paragraph3: Dynamic visualization plays a central role in MMDA-THC. There are two distinct kinds of information that need to be represented. 1) the relevance of a collocate or discourse for the topic (e.g. an association score). 2) semantic similarities and other meaning relations between different collocates and discourse descriptions.

new.name: Analysis Name
new.helpName: User-defined name for the new analysis
new.helpCorpus: The corpus for the initial collocation analysis
new.helpItems: Topics items are a set of lexemes, which form the node of a collocation analysis. Lexemes can include multi-word units (MWU).
new.helpWindowSize: Maximum window size for the initial collocation analysis.

new.name: Discourseme Name
new.helpName: User-defined name for the new discourseme
new.helpItems: Items are a set of lexemes, which form the discourseme. Lexemes can include multi-word units (MWU) and can be adjusted at a later time.

new.name: Discursive Position Name
new.helpName: User-defined name for the new discursive position
new.helpDiscoursemes: A selection of available discoursemes that are included in the discursive position. Can be adjusted at a later time.
